items.title: Avoid sha1 collisions when two learners submit the same file
items.body:
In the unlikely event that two different learners upload the same file, the second upload will overwrite the first. 

Then if one of the learners uploads another file, we will end up deleting the submission for both of them. 

Similarly, if the student state is reset for one, we will end up deleting the submission from both.

items.title: Integration tests to avoid the bug in #229
items.body:
We did a quick fix for #229 where student uploads could overwrite each other. 

We should add an integration test to avoid having a regression.

items.title: Student submission file collisions
items.body:
### Steps to reproduce

1. Navigate to an SGA problem with one account (e.g. a student). 
2. Upload a PDF file
3. Navigate to the same SGA problem with a different account (e.g. staff). 
4. Upload another PDF file. 
5. Click Grade Submissions to open the Grading interface. Note that there should be two rows, with two different file names. 
6. Click the link for each submission file to download them. 

### Expected behavior

- You should download two different files, each the same as when they were uploaded. 

### Actual behavior

- Although the two files will have different files names, they will have the same contents.

items.title: Download all submissions failing in production
items.body:
We found a few issues with the process that zips student submissions so they can be downloaded. 

- [ ] Because the zip file is created in a memory, the task will fail when there is a large number of files, or there are particularly large files
- [ ] Something about the process of moving the submissions to the temporary folder is causing some of the files to expand in size. Initial submissions over 10MB have a file size of 5-15GB after they are moved.

items.title: Clearing a student's state does not cause the submission zip file to be created again
items.body:
To reproduce: 

1. Upload a submission for an SGA problem with a couple different users
1. Click "Download All Submissions" in the staff view to create a new submission zip file
1. Clear the state for one of those users
1. Click "Download All Submissions" again

**Expected:** The zip file would be created again since the submissions have changed since the last time it was created
**Actual:** The already-created zip file is downloaded, and it contains the submission for the student whose state was cleared

The reason for this is the use of [`reset_score`](https://github.com/edx/edx-submissions/blob/master/submissions/api.py#L758) in the function that clears the student state. That API method makes the submission effectively invisible, so even though it was technically 'updated', we can't get its timestamp to see that it was updated after the creation of the last zip file. One solution to this would be to simply delete the zip file if it exists. Triggering the recreation of the zip file might make it easier for the zip creation task to be executed twice concurrently (not sure what effect that would have).

items.title: use static_asset_path from course advanced settings to find static asset path
items.body: Some courses have a static asset path set in the course's advanced settings. When this is set, the path to static assets should use a path like, for example, `/static/{static_asset_path}/images/PS1_PB3_Q1.png` instead of `/asset-v1:MITx+2.007r+2018_Spring+type@asset+block@images/PS1_PB3_Q1.png`.

items.title: Static asset links in the Solution aren't rewritten as expected (return 404)
items.body: As a course author, when I paste a static link into an HTML block (e.g. "/static/solution.pdf") it is normally rewritten when the HTML is rendered in LMS. This isn't happening in the HTML solutions in the SGA XBlock, and the links return a 404 error.

items.title: Clean up code related to submission zip creation and downloading
items.body:
There are many issues with the current code that handles zip creation and downloading, both functionality- and style-related. Among them:

- Submission files are being copied from one directory to another before being compressed, and they almost definitely do not need to be
- When there are no finalized submissions, clicking "Download All Submissions" indicates to the user that the zip file is being created, then nothing happens. We should instead disable the button in these cases, or if that's not possible/performant, we should notify the user that no submissions are available to download
- The source & target paths of the submission files and zip files should be reconsidered, and the way these paths are constructed is confusing
- The forked logic (local storage vs. S3 storage) for creating the submission zip file is probably not necessary
- Logging is basically non-existent. We should add logging in a few different places, particularly where we're writing to files.

We also have a solution in place where the entire contents of each submission file need to be loaded into memory in order to add them to the compressed file. We're using a standard library module (`zipfile`) which makes that unavoidable. This is probably OK for now, but we should look into ways that we can create a compressed file via file chunks.

items.title: "Delete Learner's State" doesn't remove the users submission
items.body:
As an instructor, I sometimes need to delete the learner's submission so they can attempt the problem again. This is often in response to a technical issue or similar. 

In an SGA block, when I delete the student state, I get a success message, but the learner's submission is still visible and they can't submit again.

items.title: Timezone handling is incorrect
items.body:
This was introduced in https://github.com/mitodl/edx-sga/pull/169#issuecomment-339054815
We should use `datetime.now(tz=timezone)` instead of `datetime.utcnow().replace(tzinfo=timezone)`. The latter will use the UTC time with the `timezone` timezone which results in the incorrect time

items.title: Add a submit button

milestone.title: MITx Spring 2018
milestone.description:
Four enhancements to support the Spring 2018 term (needs to be ready by end of December)

1. When students submit the response (pdf) to an assessment , they should be able to review before submitting it, to make sure they are not submitting the wrong file.
2. Implement a graceperiod, which is some grace period the course team allows student to submit their answer, after the deadline shown to students.
3. Course staff to be able to download all student submissions in one click, as a zip file. Now, they have to download answer files one by one.
4. After a student submit the response (usually a pdf file), the answer (a pdf file) should be revealed to her. Currently the answer is revealed only after deadline.

items.body:
As a learner, I would like to be able to review my upload before submitting it. 

As a course staff, I would like to distinguish between upload and submit, so that learners can review their uploads before they are graded. A separate submit button would also allow for me to set different `showanswer` behaviors. See #185

items.title: Support for showanswer settings

milestone.title: MITx Spring 2018
milestone.description:
Four enhancements to support the Spring 2018 term (needs to be ready by end of December)

1. When students submit the response (pdf) to an assessment , they should be able to review before submitting it, to make sure they are not submitting the wrong file.
2. Implement a graceperiod, which is some grace period the course team allows student to submit their answer, after the deadline shown to students.
3. Course staff to be able to download all student submissions in one click, as a zip file. Now, they have to download answer files one by one.
4. After a student submit the response (usually a pdf file), the answer (a pdf file) should be revealed to her. Currently the answer is revealed only after deadline.

items.body:
As a course author, I would like to be able to use [showanswer settings](http://edx.readthedocs.io/projects/edx-partner-course-staff/en/latest/course_components/create_problem.html#show-answer) with SGA. In particular, I would like to use the `Attempted` setting so that the learner is presented with a solution to the problem after choosing to submit it. 

### Acceptance criteria
- [ ] add showanswer field to SGA XBlock fields
- [ ] for backwards compatibility, if there is no showanswer value it should default to "Past Due"
- [ ] add solution field to SGA XBlock. This will contain the solution. 
- [ ] implement OLX serialization, so that the showanswer and solution settings can be exported and imported
- [ ] #186 Implement a submit button, distinct from the upload button, so the learner can upload a file, review it and then choose to submit. After submission, the file cannot be changed

### Out of scope
- Not all the supported values for `showanswer` make sense in the SGA context. We'll only implement `past_due` and `attempted`

items.title: download all student submissions in one click

milestone.title: MITx Spring 2018
milestone.description:
Four enhancements to support the Spring 2018 term (needs to be ready by end of December)

1. When students submit the response (pdf) to an assessment , they should be able to review before submitting it, to make sure they are not submitting the wrong file.
2. Implement a graceperiod, which is some grace period the course team allows student to submit their answer, after the deadline shown to students.
3. Course staff to be able to download all student submissions in one click, as a zip file. Now, they have to download answer files one by one.
4. After a student submit the response (usually a pdf file), the answer (a pdf file) should be revealed to her. Currently the answer is revealed only after deadline.

items.body:
As staff, I would like to be able to download all student submissions in one click, in addition to being able to download individual submissions. This will make it more efficient for me to review and grade submissions in a batch. 

Note that we implemented a similar feature of the LTI version of SGA, https://github.com/mitodl/sga-lti/pull/33

### acceptance criteria:

- [x] zip file name should include the course number or course key
- [x] individual submission file names should be named to include the username. This will help to identify submissions which frequently come in with all the same name. (individual download could be modified to support this as well)

### out of scope
- selective download, i.e. download only ungraded submissions, or check off submissions to download

items.title: Support for graceperiod as set in the course's grading page

milestone.title: MITx Spring 2018
milestone.description:
Four enhancements to support the Spring 2018 term (needs to be ready by end of December)

1. When students submit the response (pdf) to an assessment , they should be able to review before submitting it, to make sure they are not submitting the wrong file.
2. Implement a graceperiod, which is some grace period the course team allows student to submit their answer, after the deadline shown to students.
3. Course staff to be able to download all student submissions in one click, as a zip file. Now, they have to download answer files one by one.
4. After a student submit the response (usually a pdf file), the answer (a pdf file) should be revealed to her. Currently the answer is revealed only after deadline.

items.body:
As a course author, I like to use the grace period setting to allow for a little extra time for learners to submit responses after the published due date. See http://edx.readthedocs.io/projects/open-edx-building-and-running-a-course/en/latest/grading/grace_period.html

Currently, the SGA XBlock does not honor the grace period.

items.title: Possible issues in (i10n) work due to the way xblocks get imported before translation is set up
items.body:
https://github.com/mitodl/edx-sga/pull/174#issuecomment-332273404

>Hello! We've been working on getting Django 1.11 tests running on edx-platform and in addition to the changes you've made in this PR we've found that the use of the gettext alias _() used in sga.py also caused issues due to the way xblocks get imported before translation is set up. I believe you could fix this by just importing the lazy version of gettext/ugettext as _. A branch of edx-sga that has the minimal changes for getting tests working in edx-platform Django 1.11 is here, though in that case translations were simply removed.

Is there any chance we could get the underscore change included as part of this PR?

items.body:
In the attached image, you can see that this student view of the progress page shows a successfully submitted assignment that has been graded. However, it had no impact on the  progress chart. 

Is there a special configuration that has to be made somewhere to make a SGA have an impact on the progress chart?

items.title: "Duplicate" error when installing per instructions
items.body:
I experimented today with installing edx-sga on a new devstack (based on dogwood).

I'm pretty sure I followed your devstack instructions correctly, but when I try to run the lms, I get 

`Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "manage.py", line 112, in <module>
    startup.run()
  File "/edx/app/edxapp/edx-platform/cms/startup.py", line 31, in run
    django.setup()
  File "/edx/app/edxapp/venvs/edxapp/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/django/__init__.py", line 18, in setup
    apps.populate(settings.INSTALLED_APPS)
  File "/edx/app/edxapp/venvs/edxapp/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/django/apps/registry.py", line 89, in populate
    "duplicates: %s" % app_config.label)
django.core.exceptions.ImproperlyConfigured: Application labels aren't unique, duplicates: edx_sga`

Interestingly, I see the following code in common.py for both the lms and cms:

`OPTIONAL_APPS = (
    'mentoring',
    'problem_builder',
    'edx_sga',
`

Could it be that now we now don't have to add edx_sga to the ADDL_INSTALLED_APPS property in the lms and cms env.json files ?

If so, are the correct instructions just to pip install edx-sga and it's ready to go? This was the case for me.

Thanks!

items.title: Awaiting instructor approval - on edge.edx.org
items.body:
Hello,
I successfully used SGA on edx.org in my course (UBCx Phot1x), however, I cannot get it working in my present course on edge.edx.org (UBC ELEC413).  It says "Awaiting instructor approval"; see screenshot.

I have the "Instructor" tab at the top, and I am part of the "Staff" group, and the "Admin" group.  I can't see any other settings that specifically label me as an instructor.  The course team management section under Instructor appears the same in both edge.edx.org as well as edx.org.

Has anyone else been successful at running SGA on edge.edx.org?

Thank you
Lukas

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15843200/12214621/df413b1a-b650-11e5-8107-518d86280abb.png)

items.title: Django 1.8
items.body: edX plans to upgrade from django 1.4 to django 1.8 for the next release (Dogwood, scheduled for October 2015). We should check to make sure that SGA still works with django 1.8.

items.title: Grade entry error should be removed when the error is removed/corrected.
items.body:
Across show/hide, and across changing/removing grade values, an error (too high, low, NaN, etc), persists. It should be removed when the error is removed or corrected. The screenshot shows the error persisting on an assignment from which the grade has been removed.

![screen shot 2015-08-27 at 12 03 15 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/882377/9525796/da3cf57a-4cb3-11e5-802c-01b0e86afb22.png)

items.title: Add an "Actions" cell for the assignments table.
items.body:
There should be a header cell for "Actions" in the table header, which contains all action buttons, including the "Enter Grade", and "Upload annotated file", plus any additional buttons to be added.

![screen shot 2015-08-27 at 11 48 55 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/882377/9525335/a52d214a-4cb1-11e5-9dee-c3a70f69f643.png)

items.title: Sorting student submissions
items.body:
As a staff member, I would like to sort student submissions when viewing them in a grid. 

From [ZenDesk 2114](https://odl.zendesk.com/agent/tickets/2114)

> Currently, there doesn't appear to be rhyme or reason to the way the table is sorted. Not alphabetically, not by upload time/date.

items.title: Better error handling for missing files
items.body:
Sometimes the files get lost from S3. A missing file shouldn't cause a 500 error.

See https://odl.zendesk.com/agent/tickets/2113

items.title: Unable to upload file after changing unit
items.body:
In LMS view, as either staff or student, when I change between units in a course the file upload button allows a file to be selected, but will not update the button to confirm upload, nor does it upload the file.
Steps to recreate:
1 Create 2+ unit subsection with at least one SGA
2 enter subsection and click between units
3 goto SGA unit and try to upload file

Checked JS console and receiving an error of "too much recursion" when trying to upload file in any unit after moving between units.

This error also occurs with drag-and-drop behavior with >70 "too much recursion" errors for each attempt

Running edX Birch and most recent version of edx-sga

items.title: readme file: cms.envs.json file edit step is wrong
items.body:
There is a capitalization error in the instruction to edit cms.envs.json.  `True` should be lower-case:

`"ALLOW_ALL_ADVANCED_COMPONENTS": true,`

items.title: When upload returns an error, focus should be set to the error message
Multiple SGA components dont work
items.body:
When we try to add Multiple SGA components in the same unit for multiple submission, the functionality doesnt work.  Most of the times after selecting a file, the button doesnt get updated with file name nor it gets submitted.

This happens either both of them or sometimes any one of them.

items.title: Editing Staff Graded Assignment screen cut off title bar and save and cancel button
items.body:
We installed the Staff Graded Assignment and when I go to review the settings of the component, the title bar and save and close buttons do not display.  I am unable to apply any changes. Any thoughts on why this would be happening?  I have included a screen shot.

![sga](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12073197/7320140/8b31d43a-ea68-11e4-80a9-be4f5fe2c565.png)

items.title: Multiply assignments for one unit support
items.body:
Hi!

Here is the situation: we have added two Staff Graded Assignments for one Unit. They displays at LMS correctly. But when user is trying to upload a file for any of them it gets the javascript error:
`Uncaught RangeError: Maximum call stack size exceeded` (Chrome) or `too much recursion` (Firefox), where both points to jquery.min file.

Does multiply assignments for single unit is supported functionality? If it is, seems as a bug for me.

Thanks!

items.title: Lint all javascript with jshint and remove as many violations as possible
items.body:
We should follow the [edx Javascript standards](https://github.com/edx/edx-platform/wiki/Javascript-standards-for-the-edx-platform), but they are incomplete. 

[JSHint](http://jshint.com/) is a tool that can help. @bdero can be consulted for help with configuration, if necessary.

items.title: Race condition when removing grades
items.body:
This appears to only be reproducible in production, where there are fewer resources and more data. 

When a staff member removes grades, there's no feedback about the removal, which apparently can take several seconds. If the user repeatedly clicks the button, it will cause 500 errors (which the user never sees).

items.title: pylint cleanup
items.body: There are several pylint violations creeping in here. We should try and resolve them.  Helpful command to show them in devstack: `PYTHONPATH=lms:lms/djangoapps:lms/lib:common/djangoapps:common/lib pylint  --msg-template="{path}:{line}: [{msg_id}({symbol}), {obj}] {msg}" edx_sga | tee /edx/app/edxapp/edx-platform/reports/lms/pylint.report`

items.title: Docstrings for all the things
items.body: We need doc strings for most of this. We generally prefer the google style guide for python: http://google-styleguide.googlecode.com/svn/trunk/pyguide.html and https://pypi.python.org/pypi/sphinxcontrib-napoleon

items.title: Grade publishing

milestone.title: Fall Residential
milestone.description: All bug fixes and feature enhancements required for fall courses on MIT's campus.

items.body:
I found a bug: when you grade somebody, anyone don't see progress on it until this student view this block by himself or do something that can change his grade.

After I view through code, and found this comment:

>  # Ideally we would do this when the score is entered.  This write on
>  # read pattern is pretty bad.  Currently, though, the code in the
>  # courseware application that handles the grade event will puke if the
>  # user_id for the event is other than the logged in user.
>  ...

and this:

>  # This is how we'd like to do it.  See student_view
>  self.runtime.publish(self, 'grade', {
>        'value': state['score'],
>        'max_value': self.max_score(),
>        'user_id': module.student.id
>  })

So, I understand why it doesn't work how I expect.
Do you plan to fix it? Or, at least, do you have an idea how to do it?

items.title: Issue from 8/11 e-mail

milestone.title: Fall Residential
milestone.description: All bug fixes and feature enhancements required for fall courses on MIT's campus.

items.body: See the e-mail, "Staff Grading XBlock review"

items.title: Remove uses of assert()

milestone.title: Fall Residential
milestone.description: All bug fixes and feature enhancements required for fall courses on MIT's campus.

items.body:
edX has asked not to use assert, since it can be worked around. Presumably we should be raising exceptions in these conditions. 

> Various methods use `assert` as guard conditions, but these are
> stripped out if anyone uses the -O flag in python. This flag is rarely
> used, but programs should still not rely on asserts to enforce
> security.

Chris, let me know if you have any questions about this.

items.title: Enhance setup.py
items.body:
setup.py will need a manifest file so that templates are copied properly and other additional information added to it (license, author, etc).

(See https://github.com/jazkarta/edx-sga/issues/22)

items.title: Must work with IDDE
items.body:
- Instructor must be able to grant an extension through the IDDE interface
- When an extension is granted, student should be able to upload a file
- When an extension is removed, and the due date has passed, student should no longer be able to upload

(See https://github.com/jazkarta/edx-sga/issues/5)

items.title: Need validation for edit view
items.body:
The edit view currently has no validation. It is possible to, for example, enter a non-numeric value for "weight" and render the xblock unusable.

(See https://github.com/jazkarta/edx-sga/issues/3)

items.title: There should be a "Staff Debug" interface

milestone.title: Fall Residential
milestone.description: All bug fixes and feature enhancements required for fall courses on MIT's campus.

items.body:
I have no idea what complexities this may introduce, but it bothers me that there's no staff debug interface for this XBlock.

Does the XBlock Framework provide any help with this?

(See https://github.com/jazkarta/edx-sga/issues/10)

items.title: Refactor to use submissions app

milestone.title: Fall Residential
milestone.description: All bug fixes and feature enhancements required for fall courses on MIT's campus.

items.body:
See https://github.com/edx/edx-submissions and the corresponding post on the edx-code mailing list: https://groups.google.com/forum/#!searchin/edx-code/submission/edx-code/YrcP2770L3I/wqGkbpN7noQJ

Using submissions will avoid the current requirement that students re-visit the SGA problem in order to have their grade recorded.

(See https://github.com/jazkarta/edx-sga/issues/21)

items.title: "Enter Grade" should be a button like "Upload Annotated file"
items.body:
Or vice versa.

But I prefer buttons in this case.

(See https://github.com/jazkarta/edx-sga/issues/18)

items.title: Instructor comments should be visible in the "Grade Submissions" table

milestone.title: Fall Residential
milestone.description: All bug fixes and feature enhancements required for fall courses on MIT's campus.

items.body:
In the prototype, course staff comments are visible in the same column as the annotated file name. Although not ideal, this presentation of comments is useful for course staff reviewing the grading of their colleagues.

(See https://github.com/jazkarta/edx-sga/issues/17)

items.title: Cancelling 'Enter Grade' lightbox prevents 'Grade Submissions' lightbox from closing.

milestone.title: Fall Residential
milestone.description: All bug fixes and feature enhancements required for fall courses on MIT's campus.

items.body:
There is a work around to press the 'Grade Submissions' button again, and reset state. From which you can close the original lightbox again.

(See https://github.com/jazkarta/edx-sga/issues/19)

items.title: add support for roles and workflow

milestone.title: Fall Residential
milestone.description: All bug fixes and feature enhancements required for fall courses on MIT's campus.

items.body:
Allow staff to add grades, but they shouldn't be presented to the student (nor recorded in student state) until an instructor has approved them.

I think this can be done by adding an adding an "approved" field that can only be changed by an instructor. Grades are not returned to the student unless the approved field is set to true.

An enhancement would to have this be an optional feature, although I don't know where the option could be set -- perhaps when the problem is authored?

(see https://github.com/jazkarta/edx-sga/issues/20)

items.title: Uploading a too-large file should fail with an error message returned to the user.

milestone.title: Fall Residential
milestone.description: All bug fixes and feature enhancements required for fall courses on MIT's campus.

items.body:
I tried uploading a 5.2MB file, which should be too large for the 5MB limiit on nginx.

The upload indicator advanced to 100%, and then nothing happened. I am left without a browse button to upload another file.

The behavior should be to return an error message to the user and then allow him to upload again.

For the error message, how about "Sorry, that file is too large. Please upload a smaller file"

If it's possible to either report the size of the file that was too large or, even better, the limit (imposed by configuration) that would be nice to have in the error.

(see https://github.com/jazkarta/edx-sga/issues/6)
